snippet: Mr. Putin can achieve short-term goals, but analysts say efforts to restore President Bashar al-Assad’s control to all of Syria will be hindered by the civil war’s grim realities.
abstract: Military officials and analysts say Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin, by ordering air attacks against insurgents fighting  Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad's forces, may defend Assad's government and limit United States options in short term; point out, however, bleak reality that protracted Syrian war and a demoralized army will erode Russia's long-term goals for region.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow. Gardiner Harris and David E. Sanger contributed reporting from Washington, and Ivan Nechepurenko from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Putin can achieve short-term goals, but analysts say efforts to restore President Bashar al-Assad’s control to all of Syria will be hindered by the civil war’s grim realities.

headline.main: Vladimir Putin Plunges Into a Caldron in Syria: Saving Assad
headline.print_headline: Putin Plunges Into a Caldron: Rescuing Assad

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
